title: Lancaster Canal Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: By Brian Young (Own work) [CC0], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Lancaster Canal at Woodplumpton

images.title: By Antiquary (Own work) [GFDL (http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/fdl.html) or CC BY 4.0 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bridge 112 over Lancaster Canal

images.title: Michael Graham / Lancaster Canal
images.caption: From Old Hall bridge looking towards Crooklands on a bright winter's day in 2010

images.title: Martyn B / Tewitfield Locks
images.caption: Tewitfield Locks just north of Carnforth. This section of the Lancaster Canal is no longer navigable from the south, largely due to the fact that at this point the canal was blocked off by a new road when the M6 (visible to the left of the picture) was constructed in the 1960s. There are eight locks in total and although they no longer have gates, they are in remarkably fine condition.

images.title: Lancaster Canal, Crag Bank by Ian Taylor, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Crag Bank near Bolton le Sands

images.title: Stephen McKay / Lancaster Canal, Larkrigg
images.caption: Larkrigg near Kendal. The bridge carries a bridleway over the clearly discernible remains of the canal which once connected Preston to Kendal.

images.title: David Gruar / Lancaster Canal at Farleton
images.caption: Farleton. The ruined building on the left used to be stables for horses used on the fast packet boat services on the canal, that covered the 57 miles from Preston to Kendal in around 7 hours. The horses were changed every four or five miles.

images.title: David Medcalf / Line of Lancaster Canal in Kendal
images.caption: Line of the old canal in Kendal. Looking north. The tall lamps illuminate an all-weather sports pitch, with shared use by local school and public.

description: Follow the Lancaster Canal from Preston, in Lancashire, to Kendal, in Cumbria, on this splendid waterside walk or cycle. From the canal there are fine views of the Silverdale Coast, the Forest of Bowland AONB and the lovely Wyre countryside. The route passes Garstang, Lancaster, Morecambe Bay, Bolton le Sands and Carnforth before finishing at Kendal.
